actions.committee: House Committee on the District of Columbia
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the District of Columbia.
Reported to House from the Committee on the District of Columbia with amendment, H. Rept. 93-1436.

actions.committee: Senate Committee on the District of Columbia
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on the District of Columbia.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on the District of Columbia with amendment, S. Rept. 93-1348.

official_title: An Act to make technical amendments to the Act of September 3, 1974, relating to salary increases for District of Columbia police, firemen, and teachers, and to the District of Columbia Real Property Tax Revision Act of 1974, and for other purposes.

summary.text: (LATEST SUMMARY) Provides that District of Columbia policemen and firemen in specified salary classes shall receive, in addition to his or her scheduled rate of compensation stipulated additional compensation. Makes changes in the salary schedule contained in the District of Columbia Teachers' Salary Act of 1955 as amended by the Teachers' Salary Act Amendments of 1974. Authorizes the Mayor of the District of Columbia to make appointments to the office of the Director of Campaign Finance, subject to the advice and consent of the City Council. Provides that the Director shall serve for a term of four years. Makes technical changes in the District of Columbia Real Property Tax Revision Act. Provides that the Mayor shall appoint the three commissioners composing the Public Service Commission of the District of Columbia, except that the present members shall continue to serve until the expiration of their terms.

titles.title: A bill to amend the District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act to provide for a People's Counsel at the Public Service Commission, to make technical amendments to this act relating to police and firemen's salaries, and for other purposes.

An Act to make technical amendments to the Act of September 3, 1974, relating to salary increases for District of Columbia police, firemen, and teachers, and to the District of Columbia Real Property Tax Revision Act of 1974, and for other purposes.
